title: nbdev_quickstart
text:
– Install virtualenv on Python 3.9
Add dead-snakes repository:


```shell-script
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:deadsnakes/ppa
```

Install Python 3.9, development package and the specific venv:

```shell-script
sudo apt install python3.9
sudo apt install python3.9-dev
sudo apt install python3.9-venv
```


Create Python 3.9 virtualenv:


```shell-script
python3.9 -m venv py39
```

Install everything from the requirements.txt file (created via pip freeze > requirements.txt)

pip install -r requirements.txt

title: nbdev_quickstart
text: This file will become your README and also the index of your documentation.

title: nbdev_quickstart
text:
Developer Guide
If you are new to using nbdev here are some useful pointers to get you started.

Install nbdev_quickstart in Development mode
# make sure nbdev_quickstart package is installed in development mode
$ pip install -e .

# make changes under nbs/ directory
# ...

# compile to have changes apply to nbdev_quickstart
$ nbdev_prepare

title: nbdev_quickstart
text:
Usage

Installation
Install latest from the GitHub repository:
$ pip install git+https://github.com/rhalldearn/nbdev_quickstart.git
or from conda
$ conda install -c rhalldearn nbdev_quickstart
or from pypi
$ pip install nbdev_quickstart


Documentation
Documentation can be found hosted on this GitHub repository’s pages. Additionally you can find package manager specific guidelines on conda and pypi respectively.
